<P></P>
<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Geography">Geography</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Vinson_Massif&action=edit&section=1" title="Edit section: Geography">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>
<P>The Vinson Massif extends between <A href="/wiki/Goodge_Col" title="Goodge Col">Goodge Col</A> and <A href="/wiki/Branscomb_Glacier" title="Branscomb Glacier">Branscomb Glacier</A> to the northwest, <A href="/wiki/Nimitz_Glacier" title="Nimitz Glacier">Nimitz Glacier</A> and <A href="/wiki/Gildea_Glacier" title="Gildea Glacier">Gildea Glacier</A> to the southwest and south, and <A href="/wiki/Dater_Glacier" title="Dater Glacier">Dater Glacier</A> and its tributary <A href="/wiki/Hinkley_Glacier" title="Hinkley Glacier">Hinkley Glacier</A> to the east. The southeastern part of the <A href="/wiki/Massif" title="Massif">massif</A> ends at <A href="/wiki/Hammer_Col" title="Hammer Col">Hammer Col</A>, which joins it to the <A href="/wiki/Craddock_Massif" title="Craddock Massif">Craddock Massif</A>, of which the highest point is <A href="/wiki/Mount_Rutford" title="Mount Rutford">Mount Rutford</A> (4,477 metres (14,688 ft)). The massif comprises both the high central <A href="/wiki/Vinson_Plateau" title="Vinson Plateau">Vinson Plateau</A> with its few peaks rising to over 4,700 metres (15,400 ft), and several side ridges mostly trending southwest or northeast from the plateau.</P>
<P>The current height (4,892 metres (16,050 ft)) of Mount Vinson was measured by a GPS survey that was conducted by the 2004 Omega Foundation team comprising <A href="/wiki/Damien_Gildea" title="Damien Gildea">Damien Gildea</A> of <A href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia">Australia</A> (leader) and Rodrigo Fica and Camilo Rada of <A href="/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</A>.<SUP id="cite_ref-Gildea_8-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Gildea-8">[8]</A></SUP> Since 1998 and continuing through 2007, the Omega Foundation has placed a GPS receiver on the summit for a suitable period of time to obtain accurate satellite readings.<SUP id="cite_ref-Gildea_8-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Gildea-8">[8]</A></SUP></P>
<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Climate_and_glaciers">Climate and glaciers</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Vinson_Massif&action=edit&section=2" title="Edit section: Climate and glaciers">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>
<P>The climate on Mount Vinson is generally controlled by the polar <A href="/wiki/Ice_cap" title="Ice cap">ice cap</A>'s high-pressure system, creating predominantly stable conditions but, as in any <A href="/wiki/Polar_climate" title="Polar climate">polar climate</A>, high winds and snowfall are a possibility. Though the annual snowfall on Mount Vinson is low, high winds can cause <A href="/wiki/Base_camp" class="mw-redirect" title="Base camp">base camp</A> accumulations up to 46 centimetres (18 in) in a year. During the summer season, November through January, there are 24 hours of sunlight. While the average temperature during these months is −30 <A href="/wiki/Celsius" title="Celsius">°C</A> (−20 <A href="/wiki/Fahrenheit" title="Fahrenheit">°F</A>), the intense sun will melt snow on dark objects.<SUP class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<I><A href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><SPAN title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (September 2009)">citation needed</SPAN></A></I>]</SUP></P>
<P>Over successive years, the limited amount of snow that falls on Vinson Massif compacts and is transformed into ice, forming glaciers. These glaciers follow the topography and flow down the mountain's valleys.<SUP id="cite_ref-fr13_9-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-fr13-9">[9]</A></SUP> The uppermost glacier occupies <A href="/wiki/Jacobsen_Valley" title="Jacobsen Valley">Jacobsen Valley</A> on the north face of Mount Vinson, and flows either into <A href="/wiki/Branscomb_Glacier" title="Branscomb Glacier">Branscomb Glacier</A> to the west or <A href="/wiki/Crosswell_Glacier" title="Crosswell Glacier">Crosswell Glacier</A> to the east. The Crosswell Glacier flows into the <A href="/wiki/Rutford_Ice_Stream" title="Rutford Ice Stream">Rutford Ice Stream</A> via <A href="/wiki/Ellen_Glacier" title="Ellen Glacier">Ellen Glacier</A>.<SUP id="cite_ref-fr13_9-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-fr13-9">[9]</A></SUP> The south face of Mount Vinson is drained by <A href="/wiki/Roch%C3%A9_Glacier" title="Roché Glacier">Roché Glacier</A>, which flows westwards into Branscomb Glacier, with the latter leaving Vinson Massif to join <A href="/wiki/Nimitz_Glacier" title="Nimitz Glacier">Nimitz Glacier</A>.</P>
<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="History">History</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Vinson_Massif&action=edit&section=3" title="Edit section: History">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>
<P>A high mountain, provisionally known as 'Vinson', was long suspected to be in this part of <A href="/wiki/West_Antarctica" title="West Antarctica">West Antarctica</A>, but it was not actually seen until January 1958, when it was spotted by <A href="/wiki/US_Navy" class="mw-redirect" title="US Navy">US Navy</A> aircraft from <A href="/wiki/Byrd_Station" title="Byrd Station">Byrd Station</A>. It was named after <A href="/wiki/Carl_Vinson" title="Carl Vinson">Carl Vinson</A>, <A href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</A> <A href="/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="United States House of Representatives">Representative</A> from <A href="/wiki/Georgia_(U.S._state)" title="Georgia (U.S. state)">Georgia</A> who was a key supporter of funding for Antarctic research.<SUP id="cite_ref-gnis_4-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-gnis-4">[4]</A></SUP> The first measurement of the Vinson Massif was established in 1959 at the elevation of 5,140 m (16,864 ft).<SUP id="cite_ref-gnis_4-2" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-gnis-4">[4]</A></SUP></P>
<H3><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="First_ascent">First ascent</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Vinson_Massif&action=edit&section=4" title="Edit section: First ascent">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<P>In 1963, two groups within the <A href="/wiki/American_Alpine_Club" title="American Alpine Club">American Alpine Club</A>, one led by Charles D. Hollister and Samuel C. Silverstein, M.D., then in New York, and the other led by <A href="/wiki/Peter_Schoening" class="mw-redirect" title="Peter Schoening">Peter Schoening</A> of <A href="/wiki/Seattle,_Washington" class="mw-redirect" title="Seattle, Washington">Seattle, Washington</A>, began lobbying the <A href="/wiki/National_Science_Foundation" title="National Science Foundation">National Science Foundation</A> to support an expedition to climb Mount Vinson. The two groups merged in spring 1966 at the urging of the National Science Foundation and the American Alpine Club, and <A href="/wiki/Nicholas_Clinch" title="Nicholas Clinch">Nicholas Clinch</A> was recruited by the American Alpine Club to lead the merged expeditions. Officially named the American Antarctic Mountaineering Expedition 1966/67, the expedition was sponsored by the American Alpine Club and the <A href="/wiki/National_Geographic_Society" title="National Geographic Society">National Geographic Society</A>, and supported in the field by the <A href="/wiki/U.S._Navy" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. Navy">U.S. Navy</A> and the National Science Foundation Office of Antarctic Programs. Ten scientists and mountaineers participated in AAME 1966/67. In addition to Clinch they were Barry Corbet, John Evans (University of Minnesota, Minneapolis, MN), Eiichi Fukushima (University of Washington, Seattle, WA), Charles Hollister, Ph.D. (Columbia University, New York, NY), William Long, Ph.D. (Alaska Methodist University, Anchorage, AK), Brian Marts, <A href="/wiki/Peter_Schoening" class="mw-redirect" title="Peter Schoening">Peter Schoening</A>, Samuel Silverstein, M.D. (Rockefeller University, New York, NY) and Richard Wahlstrom.</P>
<P>In the months prior to its departure for Antarctica the expedition received considerable press attention, primarily because of the reports that <A href="/w/index.php?title=Woodrow_Wilson_Sayre&action=edit&redlink=1" class="new" title="Woodrow Wilson Sayre (page does not exist)">Woodrow Wilson Sayre</A> was planning to fly in a <A href="/wiki/Piper_Apache" class="mw-redirect" title="Piper Apache">Piper Apache</A> piloted by <A href="/wiki/Max_Conrad" title="Max Conrad">Max Conrad</A>, the "flying Grandfather", with four companions into the Sentinel Range to climb the Mount Vinson. Sayre had a reputation for problematic trips as a result of his unauthorized, unsuccessful, and nearly fatal attempt to climb <A href="/wiki/Mount_Everest" title="Mount Everest">Mount Everest</A> from the North in 1962. His unauthorized incursion into Tibet led China to file an official protest with the U.S. State Department. In the end, the purported race did not materialize as Conrad had difficulties with his plane. According to press reports, he and Sayre were still in <A href="/wiki/Buenos_Aires" title="Buenos Aires">Buenos Aires</A> on the day the first four members of AAME 1966/67 reached Mount Vinson's summit.</P>
<P>In December 1966 the Navy transported the expedition and its supplies from <A href="/wiki/Christchurch" title="Christchurch">Christchurch</A>, <A href="/wiki/New_Zealand" title="New Zealand">New Zealand</A> to the U.S. base at <A href="/wiki/McMurdo_Sound" title="McMurdo Sound">McMurdo Sound</A>, Antarctica, and from there in a ski-equipped <A href="/wiki/C-130_Hercules" class="mw-redirect" title="C-130 Hercules">C-130 Hercules</A> to the Sentinel Range. All members of the expedition reached the summit of Mount Vinson. The first group of four climbers summited on December 18, 1966, four more on December 19, and the last three on December 20.</P>
<P>On August 17, 2006, from nomination by Damien Gildea of the Omega Foundation, US-ACAN approved naming the subsidiary peaks south of Mount Vinson for the AAME 1966/67 members Nicholas Clinch, Barry Corbet, Eiichi Fukushima, Charles Hollister, Brian Marts, Samuel Silverstein, Peter Schoening and Richard Wahlstrom. Other peaks in the Sentinel Range had previously been named for John Evans and William Long.<SUP id="cite_ref-ExplorersWeb_10-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-ExplorersWeb-10">[10]</A></SUP></P>
<H3><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Later_ascents">Later ascents</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Vinson_Massif&action=edit&section=5" title="Edit section: Later ascents">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<DIV class="thumb tright">
<DIV class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><A href="/wiki/File:Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg" class="image"><IMG alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg/220px-Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg" width="220" height="148" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg/330px-Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg/440px-Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg 2x" data-file-width="516" data-file-height="347" /></A>
<DIV class="thumbcaption">
<DIV class="magnify"><A href="/wiki/File:Gavin_Antarctica_Vinson_2000.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></A></DIV>
Gavin Bate ascending Mount Vinson in 2000</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P>The climb of Vinson offers little technical difficulty beyond the usual hazards of travel in Antarctica, and as one of the <A href="/wiki/Seven_Summits" title="Seven Summits">Seven Summits</A>, it has received much attention from well-funded climbers in recent years.<SUP id="cite_ref-7summits_7-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-7summits-7">[7]</A></SUP> Multiple guide companies offer guided expeditions to Mount Vinson, at a typical cost of around $30,000 per person, including transportation to Antarctica from Chile.</P>
<H3><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="First_ascent_from_east_side">First ascent from east side</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Vinson_Massif&action=edit&section=6" title="Edit section: First ascent from east side">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<P>While the vast majority of prior climbs to the summit have used the western side of the massif from the <A href="/wiki/Branscomb_Glacier" title="Branscomb Glacier">Branscomb Glacier</A>, the first ascent from the east side was successfully completed by an eight-person team sponsored by <I><A href="/wiki/NOVA_(TV_series)" class="mw-redirect" title="NOVA (TV series)">NOVA</A></I> in January 2001.<SUP id="cite_ref-nova_6-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-nova-6">[6]</A></SUP> The team consisted of:</P>
<UL>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Conrad_Anker" title="Conrad Anker">Conrad Anker</A> – expedition leader</LI>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Jon_Krakauer" title="Jon Krakauer">Jon Krakauer</A> – mountaineer and author</LI>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Dave_Hahn" title="Dave Hahn">Dave Hahn</A> – mountain guide with 34 ascents, including ascents to <A href="/wiki/Mount_Gardner" title="Mount Gardner">Gardner</A>, and <A href="/wiki/Mount_Shinn" title="Mount Shinn">Shinn</A>.</LI>
<LI>Andrew Mclean – extreme skier</LI>
<LI>Dan Stone – <A href="/wiki/Glaciology" title="Glaciology">glaciologist</A></LI>
<LI>Lisel Clark – producer</LI>
<LI>John Armstrong – cameraman</LI>
<LI>Rob Raker – assistant cameraman and sound recording</LI>
</UL>
<P>The team not only made the first ascent from the east side but also performed scientific research into snow accumulation at different elevations as well as taking the first ground based <A href="/wiki/Global_Positioning_System" title="Global Positioning System">GPS</A> reading from the summit. The GPS reading gave the elevation of the highest point in Antarctica as 16,077 ft (4,900 m), eclipsing the earlier established heights recorded in 1959 and 1979.</P>
<P>Another first was the successful aircraft landing of a <A href="/wiki/De_Havilland_Canada_DHC-6_Twin_Otter" title="De Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter">Twin Otter</A> on the Upper <A href="/wiki/Dater_Glacier" title="Dater Glacier">Dater Glacier</A> on the eastern slopes of Mount Vinson.</P>
<P><I>NOVA</I> named the production "Mountain of Ice", which first aired on <A href="/wiki/Public_Broadcasting_Service" class="mw-redirect" title="Public Broadcasting Service">PBS</A> in February 2003.<SUP id="cite_ref-nova_6-2" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-nova-6">[6]</A></SUP></P>

<P><I><B>Tangled: The Series</B></I> is an American animated television series developed by Chris Sonnenburg and Shane Pigmore and produced by <A href="/wiki/Disney_Television_Animation" title="Disney Television Animation">Disney Television Animation</A> that premiered on <A href="/wiki/Disney_Channel" title="Disney Channel">Disney Channel</A> as a <A href="/wiki/Disney_Channel_Original_Movie" class="mw-redirect" title="Disney Channel Original Movie">Disney Channel Original Movie</A> titled <I><A href="/wiki/Tangled:_Before_Ever_After" title="Tangled: Before Ever After">Tangled: Before Ever After</A></I> on March 10, 2017, with regular episodes premiering on March 24, 2017. The series is based on the 2010 film <I><A href="/wiki/Tangled" title="Tangled">Tangled</A></I> and features the returning voices of <A href="/wiki/Zachary_Levi" title="Zachary Levi">Zachary Levi</A> and <A href="/wiki/Mandy_Moore" title="Mandy Moore">Mandy Moore</A>, alongside <A href="/wiki/Eden_Espinosa" title="Eden Espinosa">Eden Espinosa</A>, <A href="/wiki/Clancy_Brown" title="Clancy Brown">Clancy Brown</A>, and <A href="/wiki/Julie_Bowen" title="Julie Bowen">Julie Bowen</A>. In February 2017, the series was renewed for a second season ahead of the series premiere.</P>
<P></P>

<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Plot">Plot</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=1" title="Edit section: Plot">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>
<P>Since being freed from Gothel and reunited with her birth parents, King Frederic and Queen Arianna of Corona, Rapunzel adjusts to her life as their daughter and continues to have different misadventures with her boyfriend Eugene Fitzherbert, Pascal the Chameleon, Maximus the Horse, and her new handmaiden Cassandra, to uncover the mystery of her new 70 feet-long blonde hair's return.</P>
<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Characters">Characters</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=2" title="Edit section: Characters">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>
<H3><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Main">Main</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=3" title="Edit section: Main">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<UL>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Flynn_Rider" title="Flynn Rider">Eugene</A> (<A href="/wiki/Zachary_Levi" title="Zachary Levi">Zachary Levi</A>), whose previous alias is Flynn Rider, is a reformed thief and Rapunzel's boyfriend. He has a mutual dislike and mistrust for Cassandra.</LI>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Rapunzel_(Disney)" class="mw-redirect" title="Rapunzel (Disney)">Rapunzel</A> (<A href="/wiki/Mandy_Moore" title="Mandy Moore">Mandy Moore</A>) is the Princess of Corona. She tries her best to become a good future queen, even though her naive ways get her into trouble.</LI>
<LI>Cassandra (<A href="/wiki/Eden_Espinosa" title="Eden Espinosa">Eden Espinosa</A>) is Rapunzel's best friend and a <A href="/wiki/Lady-in-waiting" title="Lady-in-waiting">lady-in-waiting</A> who is the adopted daughter of the Captain of the Guards. She has a strong dislike for Eugene and is also a trained warrior.</LI>
<LI>King Frederic (<A href="/wiki/Clancy_Brown" title="Clancy Brown">Clancy Brown</A>) is the king of Corona and overprotective father of Rapunzel. Since the night his only child was taken, he naturally fears and despises magic of any kind.</LI>
<LI>Queen Arianna (<A href="/wiki/Julie_Bowen" title="Julie Bowen">Julie Bowen</A>) is the queen of Corona and Rapunzel's mother. She wants her daughter to follow her heart and do what she believes in. As an early coronation present, she had given Rapunzel a blank journal to fill its pages with her own adventures.</LI>
</UL>
<H3><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Recurring">Recurring</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=4" title="Edit section: Recurring">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<UL>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Pascal_and_Maximus" title="Pascal and Maximus">Pascal and Maximus</A> (<A href="/wiki/Dee_Bradley_Baker" title="Dee Bradley Baker">Dee Bradley Baker</A>) are respectively a chameleon who is the pet and best friend of Rapunzel whose backstory is revealed in "<A href="/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series#ep12" title="Tangled: The Series">Pascal's Story</A>" and a white stallion with the nose of a <A href="/wiki/Bloodhound" title="Bloodhound">bloodhound</A> who is originally owned by the Captain of the Guards and later by Eugene.</LI>
<LI>Corona Royal Guards are servants of King Frederic.
<UL>
<LI>Captain (<A href="/wiki/M.C._Gainey" class="mw-redirect" title="M.C. Gainey">M.C. Gainey</A>) is the unnamed leader of the Royal Guards and Cassandra's adoptive father.</LI>
<LI>Pete (<A href="/wiki/Sean_Hayes_(actor)" title="Sean Hayes (actor)">Sean Hayes</A>) is member of the Royal Guards.</LI>
<LI>Stan (<A href="/wiki/Diedrich_Bader" title="Diedrich Bader">Diedrich Bader</A>) is a member of the Royal Guards.</LI>
</UL>
</LI>
<LI>Pub Thugs are a bunch of thugs that hang out at a pub and were befriended by Rapunzel and Eugene.
<UL>
<LI>Hook Foot (<A href="/wiki/Jeff_Ross" title="Jeff Ross">Jeff Ross</A>) is the hook-footed brother of Hook Hand. Hook Foot takes the place of his brother who is on a world tour as a concert pianist.</LI>
<LI>Big Nose (<A href="/wiki/Jeffrey_Tambor" title="Jeffrey Tambor">Jeffrey Tambor</A>) is a big-nosed thug that is the romantic of the thugs.</LI>
<LI>Shorty (<A href="/wiki/Paul_F._Tompkins" title="Paul F. Tompkins">Paul F. Tompkins</A>) is a short, old, and crazy thug.</LI>
<LI>Vladimir (<A href="/wiki/Charles_Halford" title="Charles Halford">Charles Halford</A>) is a thug in a bull-horned helmet that is the strongest of the thugs. He was previously voiced by <A href="/wiki/Richard_Kiel" title="Richard Kiel">Richard Kiel</A> in the movie.</LI>
<LI>Attila Buckethead (<A href="/wiki/Steven_Blum" title="Steven Blum">Steven Blum</A>) is a thug in a full metal helmet whose passion is baking. He becomes Monty's assistant in "<A href="/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series#ep11" title="Tangled: The Series">One Angry Princess</A>". He was previously voiced by <A href="/wiki/Byron_Howard" title="Byron Howard">Byron Howard</A> in the movie.</LI>
</UL>
</LI>
<LI>Lady Caine (<A href="/wiki/Laura_Benanti" title="Laura Benanti">Laura Benanti</A>) is the main antagonist of <I><A href="/wiki/Tangled:_Before_Ever_After" title="Tangled: Before Ever After">Tangled: Before Ever After</A></I>. On Rapunzel's coronation day she launches and attack alongside some thieves, in order to get revenge on Rapunzel's father, King Fredric for taking her father away. Rapunzel has no other choice and reveals her new 70 feet golden hair and, with the help of her friends, defeat all the thugs who get arested. She returns in "<A href="/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series#ep15" title="Tangled: The Series">Max's Enemy</A>" where her horse Axel breaks her out without any suspicion as he intentionally became part of the royal guard. However, Maximus has suspected Axel all along and stops the two.</LI>
<LI>Uncle Monty (<A href="/wiki/Richard_Kind" title="Richard Kind">Richard Kind</A>) is an elderly shopkeeper in Corona who has personal issues with Rapunzel.</LI>
<LI>Nigel (<A href="/wiki/Peter_MacNicol" title="Peter MacNicol">Peter MacNicol</A>) is King Frederic's adviser.</LI>
<LI>Xavier (<A href="/wiki/Adewale_Akinnuoye-Agbaje" title="Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje">Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje</A>) is a blacksmith who appears to be well-versed with Corona's history.</LI>
<LI>Lance Strongbow (<A href="/wiki/James_Monroe_Iglehart" title="James Monroe Iglehart">James Monroe Iglehart</A>) is Eugene's old childhood friend and former partner-in-crime from his younger thieving days. His real name is revealed to be Arnwaldo Schnitz. He first appeared in "<A href="/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series#ep7" title="Tangled: The Series">The Return of Strongbow</A>".</LI>
<LI>Varian (<A href="/wiki/Jeremy_Jordan_(actor_born_1984)" class="mw-redirect" title="Jeremy Jordan (actor born 1984)">Jeremy Jordan</A>) is a clumsy, but smart, young alchemist. He tries to help Rapunzel discover the secrets of her newly regrown hair. He later serves as the main antagonist for the second part of the first season. When Rapunzel, initially unable to help him free his father from crystal encasement due to the winter storm threatening Corona, he seeks revenge on her and Corona. After betraying Rapunzel and stealing the flower that helped giving birth to her, he discoveres that the magic in the flower is gone, but now lives in Rapunzel. So, he launches an attack on her 19th birthday and captures queen Arianna to convince Rapunzel come and help him release his father. But, after Rapunzel accepts her connection with the black rocks, they destroy Varian's army of robots and he is arrested for his crimes against Corona. As Varian is taken away, he swears once again to release his father and make him proud. King Fredric promises to Rapunzel that one day Varian will receive all the help he needs.</LI>
<LI>Quirin (<A href="/wiki/Jonathan_Banks" title="Jonathan Banks">Jonathan Banks</A>) is Varian's disapproving father, currently encased in golden crystals as an offshoot of the mysterious stone spikes ravaging Corona.</LI>
<LI>Angry (Vivian Vencer) is an angry young thief and one of the twins Eugene and Lance convinced to change their ways in "Big Brothers of Corona".</LI>
<LI>Red (Ruby Jay) is a quiet young red haired thief and the second of the twins from "Big Brothers of Corona".</LI>
<LI>Ruth (<A href="/wiki/Danielle_Brooks" title="Danielle Brooks">Danielle Brooks</A>) is a bitter ghost who first appears in "<A href="/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series#ep14" title="Tangled: The Series">The Wrath of Ruthless Ruth</A>". She's able to pass on to the afterlife with Rapunzel and the Snuggly Duckling gang's participation in one of her lost melodies.</LI>
<LI>Old Lady Crowley (<A href="/wiki/Pat_Carroll_(actress)" title="Pat Carroll (actress)">Pat Carroll</A>) is a grumpy old lady known to never smile. Eugene calls her "Scowley Crowley".</LI>
<LI>Willow (<A href="/wiki/Jane_Krakowski" title="Jane Krakowski">Jane Krakowski</A>) is Queen Ariana's estranged younger sister who arrives unexpectedly on Ariana's birthday. As a birthday present, she gives Ariana a small creature with a green rattle that she must have at all times.</LI>
<LI>Feldspar (Zachary Levi) is the local cobbler of Corona. Levi does an impression of comedian <A href="/wiki/Ed_Wynn" title="Ed Wynn">Ed Wynn</A> for the character.</LI>
</UL>
<H3><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Supporting">Supporting</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=5" title="Edit section: Supporting">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<UL>
<LI><A href="/wiki/Mother_Gothel" title="Mother Gothel">Mother Gothel</A> (<A href="/wiki/Donna_Murphy" title="Donna Murphy">Donna Murphy</A>) is the deceased adoptive mother of Rapunzel who abducted her as an infant due to her golden hair's unique healing abilities, which she then hoarded for herself to sustain her youth and beauty. She aged into dust at the end of the <A href="/wiki/Tangled" title="Tangled">original movie</A>. She is first seen in a nightmare of Rapunzel's shortly after her 70-feet golden hair mysteriously grew back and gained new mystical abilities. Gothel claimed that she had "risen from the dead" and that it was time for Rapunzel to return to her tower where she would be "safe and secure."</LI>
<LI>The Stabbington Brothers (<A href="/wiki/Ron_Perlman" title="Ron Perlman">Ron Perlman</A>) are the former partners-in-crime of Eugene, whom he betrayed in his thieving days as Flynn Rider. They had worked with Mother Gothel to get Rapunzel back in order to get revenge, but were captured by the royal guards soon after. They first appeared in "<A href="/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series#ep6" title="Tangled: The Series">Cassandra v. Eugene</A>" where they use the "game" created by Rapunzel to escape from their cell and capture Eugene and Cassandra. However, as they are about to kill Eugene in revenge, he and Cass work together and defeated the two who were, most probably, locked up once again.</LI>
</UL>
<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Production">Production</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=6" title="Edit section: Production">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>
<P>On June 3, 2015, Disney Channel announced that the series was in development.<SUP id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-1">[1]</A></SUP> On February 15, 2017, it was announced that the series had been renewed for a second season ahead of the series premiere.<SUP id="cite_ref-Deadline_2-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Deadline-2">[2]</A></SUP> The series features new songs from <A href="/wiki/Alan_Menken" title="Alan Menken">Alan Menken</A>, who wrote and scored the songs for the original movie, and <A href="/wiki/Glenn_Slater" title="Glenn Slater">Glenn Slater</A>.<SUP id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-3">[3]</A></SUP></P>
<H2><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Episodes">Episodes</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=7" title="Edit section: Episodes">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H2>

<TABLE class="wikitable plainrowheaders wikiepisodetable" style="width:100%">
<TBODY><TR style="color:black;text-align:center">
<TH scope="col" style="background:#FADA5E;width:5%"><ABBR title="Number">No.</ABBR><BR />
overall</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#FADA5E;width:23%">Title <SPAN style="background-color:white;padding:1px;display:inline-block;line-height:50%"><SUP id="cite_ref-The_Futon_Critic_4-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-The_Futon_Critic-4">[4]</A></SUP><SUP id="cite_ref-Zap2it_5-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Zap2it-5">[5]</A></SUP></SPAN></TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#FADA5E;width:14%">Directed by</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#FADA5E;width:28%">Written by</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#FADA5E;width:21%">Original air date <SPAN style="background-color:white;padding:1px;display:inline-block;line-height:50%"><SUP id="cite_ref-The_Futon_Critic_4-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-The_Futon_Critic-4">[4]</A></SUP><SUP id="cite_ref-Zap2it_5-1" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Zap2it-5">[5]</A></SUP></SPAN></TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#FADA5E;width:9%">U.S. viewers<BR />
(millions)</TH>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep1" style="text-align:center">1</TH>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left"><I><A href="/wiki/Tangled:_Before_Ever_After" title="Tangled: Before Ever After">Tangled: Before Ever After</A></I></TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield and Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD>Jase Ricci</TD>
<TD>March 10, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-03-10</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD>2.87<SUP id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-6">[6]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="6" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #FADA5E">
<P>Six months after the events of <I><A href="/wiki/Tangled" title="Tangled">Tangled</A></I>, Rapunzel is settling into life in the kingdom of Corona, but is unable to enjoy her life with the constant protection of her father's guards. When she and her lady-in-waiting, Cassandra, sneak out of the castle, they come upon some magical black rock spikes that magically bring back her long blonde hair (which is now indestructable, so Rapunzel has to hide it from everyone, especially her parents). Eventually, Eugene, Maximus and Pascal find out about the hair as well, but Rapunzel decides not to tell Eugene about how she got her hair back (because Cassandra doesn't trust him), a decision which he hardly agrees with. Rapunzel manages to hide her hair from her parents, but becomes very nervous because of her coronation day. To complicate matters, a female rogue, Lady Caine, appears at Rapunzel's coronation with a hatred of King Frederic who had taken away her father a long time ago. With no other choice, Rapunzel reveals her new 70-feet long hair and, with her friends' help, defeats the thugs. Later, that night, Rapunzel admits to her father that she had snuck out of the castle (but doesn't mention anything about Cassandra helping her), so King Fredric has no other choice, but to forbid Rapunzel from leaving the walls of Corona. Rapunzel feels trapped again (just like in her old tower), but with her mother's encouragement, she decides to take her relationship and role in Corona one day at a time.</P>
A little while later, a mysterious individual comes across the site of the magical flower that cured Rapunzel's mother and was the original source of her magical long blonde hair. We see now there is nothing left, but even more mysterious black rock spikes covering the area.</TD>
</TR>
</TBODY></TABLE>
<H3><SPAN id="Season_1_.282017.E2.80.9318.29"></SPAN><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Season_1_(2017–18)">Season 1 (2017–18)</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=10" title="Edit section: Season 1 (2017–18)">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>
<TABLE class="wikitable plainrowheaders wikiepisodetable" style="width:100%">
<TBODY><TR style="color:white;text-align:center">
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:5%"><ABBR title="Number">No.</ABBR><BR />
overall</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:5%"><ABBR title="Number">No.</ABBR> in<BR />
season</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:18%">Title <SPAN style="background-color:white;padding:1px;display:inline-block;line-height:50%"><SUP id="cite_ref-The_Futon_Critic_4-2" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-The_Futon_Critic-4">[4]</A></SUP><SUP id="cite_ref-Zap2it_5-2" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Zap2it-5">[5]</A></SUP></SPAN></TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:14%">Directed by</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:28%">Written by</TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:14%">Original air date <SPAN style="background-color:white;padding:1px;display:inline-block;line-height:50%"><SUP id="cite_ref-The_Futon_Critic_4-3" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-The_Futon_Critic-4">[4]</A></SUP><SUP id="cite_ref-Zap2it_5-3" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Zap2it-5">[5]</A></SUP></SPAN></TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:7%"><ABBR title="Production">Prod.</ABBR><BR />
code <SPAN style="background-color:white;padding:1px;display:inline-block;line-height:50%"><SUP id="cite_ref-The_Futon_Critic_4-4" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-The_Futon_Critic-4">[4]</A></SUP><SUP id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-7">[7]</A></SUP></SPAN></TH>
<TH scope="col" style="background:#483D8B;width:9%">U.S. viewers<BR />
(millions)</TH>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep2" style="text-align:center">2</TH>
<TD>1</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"What the Hair!?"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Dave Schiff</TD>
<TD>March 24, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-03-24</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc101">101</TD>
<TD>1.30<SUP id="cite_ref-Showbuzz_Daily_March_24,_2017_8-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Showbuzz_Daily_March_24,_2017-8">[8]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Rapunzel and Cassandra seek out an alchemist in their first attempt of solving the mystery as to how and why Rapunzel's golden 70-feet hair grew back. Eugene follows them but things don't go quite as planned: they find Varian, a 14 years old alchemist who agrees to help uncover the mystery of Rapunzel's hair. However, Varian had built some underground machines which get out of control and destroy the village. Luckily, no one gets hurt and the test shows some important facts about Rapunzel's hair: it's completely indestructable and doesn't have any healing powers anymore, but now can completely cover somebody and protect him (shown when the hair became a giant ball around Rapunzel and Eugene which protected them from the rubble). As they leave, Rapunzel begins telling Eugene about the events of the night when her hair grew back (which Eugene promises to keep secret) and the black rocks slowly start growing back and multiply themselves.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep3" style="text-align:center">3</TH>
<TD>2</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Rapunzel's Enemy"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD><I>Story by</I> : Dave Schiff and <A href="/wiki/Noelle_Stevenson" title="Noelle Stevenson">Noelle Stevenson</A><BR />
<I>Written by</I> : Katie Mattila</TD>
<TD>March 31, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-03-31</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc102">102</TD>
<TD>1.05<SUP id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-9">[9]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">During the annual Gopher Festival, Rapunzel is booed by a man in the crowd when she shows her new emblem to the people of Corona. After finding out that the person who booed her is an eldery shopkeeper who everyone loves, Rapunzel is determined to uncover Uncle Monty's disapproval of her, even if it means disguising herself. Eventually she inspires Monty to participate at the Gopher Festival Tournament, but during the race she has to rescue him from a waterfall, resulting in blowing her disguise. Monty tells her that he boooed her because he doesn't like all these new changes in the kingdom that occurred due to her return as a princess and the two remain enemies, but respect each other. Monty wins the race and Rapunzel booos him as a sign of their "special relationship". At his sweets shop, Monty looks very proud at his trophy, realising he wouldn't have won if it hadn't been Rapunzel to help him follow his dream.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep4" style="text-align:center">4</TH>
<TD>3</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Fitzherbert P.I."</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD><I>Story by</I> : Ricky Roxburgh and Suzanne Weber<BR />
<I>Written by</I> : Jase Ricci</TD>
<TD>April 7, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-04-07</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc103">103</TD>
<TD>1.02<SUP id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-10">[10]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">After successfully catching a criminal, Eugene trains to be a royal guard. Unfortunately, the Captain of the Guard, who happens to be Cassandra's father, shares Cassandra's loathing of him. Meanwhile, Rapunzel prepares for her royal portrait to be painted by the revered Italian painter Giovanni. Eugene realizes that Giovanni is a fraud and manages to catch the imposter. The Captain of the Guards then gives Eugene a job of his own: Teaching the guards to "think like a thief" in order to catch one.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep5" style="text-align:center">5</TH>
<TD>4</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Challenge of the Brave"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Ricky Roxburgh</TD>
<TD>April 14, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-04-14</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc104">104</TD>
<TD>0.96<SUP id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-11">[11]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Cassandra trains hard to enter the Challenge of the Brave, but when Rapunzel learns of the competition, she wants to enter as well. Cassandra lies to Rapunzel to keep her out of the competition, but Rapunzel later learns through Eugene that anyone can enter. They both make it to the final battle, and Rapunzel wins because Cassandra accidentally steps out of the ring. Cassandra happily agrees with this and introduces the audience to the winner, but, realizing her friend's true feelings, Rapunzel gives the trophy to Cassandra.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep6" style="text-align:center">6</TH>
<TD>5</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Cassandra v. Eugene"</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD>Katie Mattila</TD>
<TD>April 21, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-04-21</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc105">105</TD>
<TD>0.97<SUP id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-12">[12]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Cassandra and Eugene have been arguing a lot. In order to coerce them to get along, Rapunzel tricks them into entering a dungeon cell and locks them up so that they can settle their differences by solving a series of quizes in order to get out. Of course Rapunzel's plan doesn't go well when the Stabbington Brothers plan to take advantage of this and, after Cassandra and Eugene fail because they kept fighting each other, they manage to get out. Now stuck with no way out, Eugene and Cass put their diffrences aside and get to know each other better. But they get intrerupted by the Stabbington Brothers who take the two prisoners. The guards arrive and attempt to catch them from behind, but without any results. Cassandra and Eugene work togheter and manage to take down the brothers and, with Rapunzel's help get out the secret passages beneath Corona. Everything is now back to normal and Cassandra and Eugene are on better terms...until Eugene makes Cassie mad again and they start another fight, which Rapunzel decides to not take part in anymore.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep7" style="text-align:center">7</TH>
<TD>6</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"The Return of Strongbow"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Dave Schiff</TD>
<TD>April 28, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-04-28</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc106">106</TD>
<TD>1.01<SUP id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-13">[13]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">An old childhood friend and fellow partner-in-crime of Eugene's, Lance Strongbow, comes to Corona to ask him for help. Cassandra, naturally, does not trust Strongbow. Eugene reluctantly decides to aid his childhood partner-in-crime, but learns that they have broken into the basement of the Baron himself, their old enemy. They manage to escape with the treasure, but find a ring with Corona's crest, Eugene suddenly recalls that the ring he had stolen eight years ago belonged to Queen Ariana. Rapunzel and Cassandra find out and Lance apologises for all the things he has done to Eugene and promises to change. Eugene admits all of his past actions to his now mother-in-law, who forgives him. Outside, Eugene gives Rapunzel a jeweled flower and apologizes for having lied to her. King Fredric sees the ring on Ariana's finger, to which she replies that Eugene had "found it that morning." Lance keeps his promise and donates the treasure to the Corona Orphange.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep8" style="text-align:center">8</TH>
<TD>7</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"In Like Flynn"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD>Han-Yee Ling</TD>
<TD>July 23, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-07-23</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc107">107</TD>
<TD>0.94<SUP id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-14">[14]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">When Corona is pranked by a rival kingdom, King Fredric sets off to prank it back, accompanied by Eugene who wants to prove is father-in-law that he deserves to be respected. The two sneak inside King Trevor's castle, but Eugene discovers that Fredric was planning to steal Trevor's seal pet and the two get captured and locked up. While inside the cell, Fredric tells Eugene that he saved his daughter and there is no one whom he could be respecting more than him. They get out and prank King Trevor by making him fall in one of his own trapdoors, and take the seal with them which they release into the sea. Meanwhile, Rapunzel tries to master the art of pranking, which is a new concept to her. In the end, King Trevor is tied up on one of his statues with a sign reading "Corona Rules" and the seal is swimming free in the sea.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep9" style="text-align:center">9</TH>
<TD>8</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Great Expotations"</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD>Ricky Roxburgh</TD>
<TD>July 30, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-07-30</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc108">108</TD>
<TD>0.99<SUP id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-15">[15]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">A science exposition is held in Corona, and Cassandra has a chance to be on guard duty, but she must finish her Lady-in-waiting obligations first. Varian makes a deal with Cass that he will help finish her chores if she agrees to assist him in his demonstration. However, Cass accepts the assignment to guard the famous scientist who is judging the contest and thus unavailable to help. When things go wrong, though, she chooses her friend over duty. Meanwhile, Rapunzel tries to make an entry for the science fair. After the science fair is over, Varian shows Cassandra and Rapunzel the strange black rocks spikes outside his village, much like the ones that made Rapunzel's hair grow back. Varian decides to help Rapunzel and Cass in discovering the mystery of these rock spikes and the connection between them and the newfound magical abilities of Rapunzel's regrown hair.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep10" style="text-align:center">10</TH>
<TD>9</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Under Raps"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Kelly Hannon</TD>
<TD>August 6, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-08-06</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc109">109</TD>
<TD>0.87<SUP id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-16">[16]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">During a love festival, Corona displays a book full of signatures of lovers in honor of an old ruler falling in love with the leader of a rival kingdom. Cassandra suddenly gets very secretive, and Rapunzel learns it's because she's been seeing a guy. Cassandra doesn't want Rapunzel meddling, but the princess suggests a double date and they all go off in a hot air balloon. The guy turns out to be part of an old faction that didn't like the unification of Corona and wants to steal the book, but Cassandra suspected that all along. With Rapunzel's and Eugene's help, she manages to defeat him and recover the book. In the end, Cassandra receives a medal for her actions.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep11" style="text-align:center">11</TH>
<TD>10</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"One Angry Princess"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD><I>Story by</I> : Katie Mattila and Jase Ricci<BR />
<I>Written by</I> : Jase Ricci</TD>
<TD>August 13, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-08-13</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc110">110</TD>
<TD>1.13<SUP id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-17">[17]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Attila is finally opening up his own bakery, but people generally don't want to stop by because of his scary helmet. The next day, Monty's Sweet Shoppe is destroyed, and Attila is arrested. He is about to be banished from the kingdom, but Rapunzel makes an appeal to investigate the matter further. She fails to learn the truth within the 24 hour time limit, but does figure it out just as the boat is leaving. It turns out it was actually the goat who trashed the store, being trapped inside when the store's bell rang, which sent it into a rampage. Attila, unguilty, teams up with Monty and open a sweet shop togheter while Lance takes up Attila's former job as the chef of the Snuggly Duckling.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep12" style="text-align:center">12</TH>
<TD>11</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Pascal's Story"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Ricky Roxburgh</TD>
<TD>August 20, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-08-20</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc114">114</TD>
<TD>0.93<SUP id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-18">[18]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Pascal wants to spend time with Rapunzel like their days in the tower, but her princess duties and new friends keep pushing him aside. Being so rejected, he runs away to return to the tower. An old predator looks to get revenge on the small lizard now that he's all alone again. Rapunzel realizes that Pascal went missing and cancels every royal activity planned in order to look for him. She realizes where he went and Rapunzel, Eugene and Cassandra had to "where everything happened". Rapunzel enters the tower alone and helps Pascal throw the predator away. The two reconcile and Rapunzel promises to spend more time together with her old friend.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep13" style="text-align:center">13</TH>
<TD>12</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Big Brothers of Corona"</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD>Han-Yee Ling</TD>
<TD>October 1, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-10-01</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc115">115</TD>
<TD>1.06<SUP id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-19">[19]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Eugene and Lance are told to stop a crime spree that is spreading across Corona. Eugene finds a pattern, and is able to set a trap for the thief. It turns out it was actually a pair of two young girls committing the crimes. Feeling sympathy for the girls, Eugene and Lance spend time with them both, trying to convince them to change their ways from stealing. It's revealed that the girls are actually running from the Baron's men and steal Rapunzel's crown in order to have enough money to run away and never come back. Eugene and Lance hand themselves over to the Baron's men, allowing the girls to run away. But, after they realize that the two were the only ones who had ever helped them, they return and all four escape. In the meantime, Cassandra accidentally breaks her leg and needs to rest, but Rapunzel keeps intrerupting her to make sure that she has everything she needs, but learns that sometimes people don't need help. You just have to stay and support them until they will ask for it. In the end, the girls return everything they have stolen, proving that they have changed, much to Eugene's and Lance's happiness. The girls run from Corona, but will return ... when they "will be prepared".</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep14" style="text-align:center">14</TH>
<TD>13</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"The Wrath of Ruthless Ruth"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Kelly Hannon</TD>
<TD>October 8, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-10-08</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc117">117</TD>
<TD>0.83<SUP id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-20">[20]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Rapunzel and the Captain of the Guard are trapped in the Snuggly Duckling by a fierce storm, and the building turns out to be haunted by its former owner, Ruthless Ruth. The Captain and the thugs attempt to escape, but the pub is surrounded by magic and there is no escape until they give Ruth what she wants. Rapunzel follows the clues and finds that despite Ruth's reputation as the "worst thug that ever lived", she did also have a dream: to hear her song being sung by someone else. Eveyone, including the Captain, sing Ruth's song and are now free. Rapunzel and the Captain of the Guard return to the castle where Rapunzel understand how worried her father is and avoids any confrontation for sending the whole royal guard to look after her.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep15" style="text-align:center">15</TH>
<TD>14</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Max's Enemy"</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD><I>Story by</I> : Katie Mattila<BR />
<I>Written by</I> : Dave Schiff</TD>
<TD>October 15, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-10-15</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc118">118</TD>
<TD>0.85<SUP id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-21">[21]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">A new horse, Axel, shows up in Corona and quickly shows up Max in every way. However, only Max sees the true devious nature of Axel's behavior. Axel even joins the royal guard, and beats all of Max's former records. However, Axel's true intention was to rescue Lady Caine from the dungeon, along with the gold transfer already planned. Max finds out, but falls into a trap set by Axel. While he, Lady Caine and the gold escape without any suspicion, Rapunzel comes to apologize for everyone's behavior of ignoring him over Axel. But finds the trap and discovers the plan as well. Rapunzel and Max chase after the two and, after Lady Caine is recaptured, Max races Axel. Eventually he defeats him just as Rapunzel, Eugene, Lance and the guards arive. Max is seen as a hero by everyone again.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep16" style="text-align:center">16</TH>
<TD>15</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"The Way of the Willow"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD>Katie Mattila</TD>
<TD>October 22, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-10-22</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc119">119</TD>
<TD>0.94<SUP id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-22">[22]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">It's Queen Arianna's birthday, and she receives an unexpected guest: her estranged sister, Willow. Willow and Rapunzel quickly bond, sharing a lot of the same personality traits, and Arianna feels a bit left out. To add to her aggravation, Willow gave her a pet with an annoying rattle. Eventually, Arianna explodes at her sister, letting her know her irritation with her and throws away the rattle. The pet starts to multiply and rampage over the countryside. The sisters make up and retrieve the rattle, which calms the beast and removes all the other critters. Willow disappears, promising to be more responsible, but forgets the pet she promised to look after.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep17" style="text-align:center">17</TH>
<TD>16</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Queen for a Day"</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD>Jase Ricci</TD>
<TD>November 19, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-11-19</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc111">111</TD>
<TD>1.22<SUP id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-23">[23]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">The black rocks keep spreading in Old Corona and begin approaching the castle, resulting in Varian and his father, Quirin go and talk to king Frederic. But Quirin doesn't say anything about the rocks, so Varian talks to Rapunzel who promises to help him with this problem. The following day, Rapunzel takes over the kingdom while her parents go away for their anniversary. Unfortunately, every royal decision she makes to help the people of Corona backfires badly. Meanwhile, Varian starts testing the mystical rocks, but his father tells him to stay away and refuses to tell him anything. As if anything couldn't go worse at the castle, a blizzard strikes Corona, resulting in everyone looking inside their houses, as well as an accident in the mountains, trapping Frederic and Arianna. With her parents in danger, Rapunzel takes one of the hardest decision and sends Eugene and the other thugs to rescue them. In the meantime, one of Varian's experiments result in the rocks trapping Quirin inside them and Varian rushing to the castle to ask for Rapunzel's help. On the way there he sings about hoping to make his father proud, but when he gets there Rapunzel makes another hard decision and tells him that she can't help him right now, resulting in Varian returning home, feeling betrayed. Left with no other choice, Rapunzel orders the evacuation of the island, but then remembers about the legend told earlier by Xavier about an underground machine built by the wizard Lord Demanitus, with the power to change the way of the blizzard. Rapunzel, Cassandra, Xavier and Pascal find the machine and Pascal almost gets killed in order to turn it on. With the machine activated, the blizzard disappears, the evacuation is canceled, Frederic and Arianna are saved and everything is back to normal. Back at the castle, Rapunzel confesses to Eugene that it was the hardest day of her life due to all the hard decisions she had to made, but Eugene cheers her up saying that there is still much time until she will become queen and enjoy her life until then. In a final scene, Quirin is completely trapped inside the rocks, holding a message for Varian who, saddened, swears to release his father at any costs and get revenge on everyone who stands in his way.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep18" style="text-align:center">18</TH>
<TD>17</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Painter's Block"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD>Dave Schiff</TD>
<TD>November 25, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-11-25</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD><SMALL><SPAN style="color: #2C2C2C" title="To be announced">TBA</SPAN></SMALL></TD>
<TD>0.99<SUP id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-24">[24]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Feeling traumatized after the events of the storm, Rapunzel is feeling a bit out of sorts, even having trouble painting again. She starts taking a new class with a mysterious new art instructor. The other members of the class disappear one by one to a mysterious location by the sea, apparently painting an old, withered tree. The instructor is revealed to actually be an old witch serving Zamfiri (the monster who released the blizzard) who has been released after using the weather machine and now wants to release her master as well. Eugene and Cassandra head over to rescue Rapunzel, but after they get captured, Rapunzel must finish the painting and release Zamfiri in order to rescue them. However, now that she understood that "difficult decisions are what make us who we are", she destroys the painting, trapping Zamfiri and the witch forever, and saves Eugene and Cassandra. Now, Rapunzel has completely recovered her happy, positive attitude and decided to not let herself affected that easy anymore.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep19" style="text-align:center">19</TH>
<TD>18</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Not in the Mood"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD>Kelly Hannon</TD>
<TD>December 2, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-12-02</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD><SMALL><SPAN style="color: #2C2C2C" title="To be announced">TBA</SPAN></SMALL></TD>
<TD>0.95<SUP id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-25">[25]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Thanks to Max and Pascal's intervention, Rapunzel, Eugene, and Cassandra magically exchange personalities in the midst of an important royal visit. They turn to Xavier for his help in reversing their personalities to normal. Unfortunately, the elixir switches everyone's character, making a mess of the royal visit. Rapunzel later throws the half-filled potion into the river, surprised that something so small could have such an effect. However, instead of sinking, it floats down to Old Corona village and is found by Varian.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep20" style="text-align:center">20</TH>
<TD>19</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"The Quest for Varian"</TD>
<TD>Tom Caulfield</TD>
<TD>Ricky Roxburgh</TD>
<TD>December 9, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-12-09</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD><SMALL><SPAN style="color: #2C2C2C" title="To be announced">TBA</SPAN></SMALL></TD>
<TD>1.06<SUP id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-26">[26]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Rapunzel, Eugene and Cassandra go to Old Corona in search of Varian, who has left behind important clues for them to follow, as well as a warning that a mysterious group of knights will be pursuing them.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep21" style="text-align:center">21</TH>
<TD>20</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"The Alchemist Returns"</TD>
<TD>Joe Oh</TD>
<TD>Dave Schiff</TD>
<TD>December 16, 2017<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2017-12-16</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD><SMALL><SPAN style="color: #2C2C2C" title="To be announced">TBA</SPAN></SMALL></TD>
<TD>0.96<SUP id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-27">[27]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">Varian comes to Rapunzel for help in finding the remnants of the mystical golden flower, which may hold the key to stopping the Black Rocks. Working together, they venture through the old tunnels beneath Corona. However, as they reach their prize, Varian betrays Rapunzel and steals the flower so he can use it to free his father. Unfortunately, his attempt fails, only for him to realize that the flower's actual magic now exists within Rapunzel.</TD>
</TR>
<TR class="vevent" style="text-align:center;background:#F2F2F2">
<TH scope="row" id="ep22" style="text-align:center">22</TH>
<TD>21</TD>
<TD class="summary" style="text-align:left">"Secret of the Sundrop"</TD>
<TD>Stephen Sandoval</TD>
<TD><I>Story by</I> : Jase Ricci<BR />
<I>Written by</I> : Kelly Hannon, Jase Ricci, Ricky Roxburgh, Dave Schiff, and Jeremy Shipp</TD>
<TD>January 13, 2018<SPAN style="display:none"> (<SPAN class="bday dtstart published updated">2018-01-13</SPAN>)</SPAN></TD>
<TD id="pc122">122</TD>
<TD>0.96<SUP id="cite_ref-Showbuzz_Daily_January_13,_2018_28-0" class="reference"><A href="#cite_note-Showbuzz_Daily_January_13,_2018-28">[28]</A></SUP></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="description" colspan="8" style="border-bottom:solid 3px #483D8B">On Rapunzel's 19th birthday, Corona is beset by an automaton attack from Varian, which causes Frederic to lock Rapunzel in her room to keep her safe from further danger. Eugene and Cassandra help break her out to go after Varian, but the alchemist uses his pet raccoon, mutated as a wild beast, to assault the kingdom, incapacitating many of the Royal Guards and using the chaos to kidnap Arianna, whom he uses as leverage to lure Rapunzel to Old Corona. Led by Cassandra, Eugene, Rapunzel, and Frederic, the Royal Guards lay siege to Varian's house, who uses automatons to keep them at bay. Varian attempts to use Rapunzel's hair to free his father, but it is of no use. Angry and with nothing left to lose, he uses a giant automaton to attack, threatening to kill Cassandra and Arianna. Rapunzel, however, uses her connection to the black rocks to defeat Varian, who is arrested for his crimes and vows vengeance. Rapunzel notices that the rocks are now pointing away from Corona and towards an unknown destination beyond the border wall, a path which Rapunzel is encouraged to follow. In a post-credits scene, a mysterious warrior arrives and uses a special sword to slice through the seemingly impenetrable black rocks.</TD>
</TR>
</TBODY></TABLE>
<H3><SPAN id="Tangled:_Short_Cuts_.282017.29"></SPAN><SPAN class="mw-headline" id="Tangled:_Short_Cuts_(2017)"><I>Tangled: Short Cuts</I> (2017)</SPAN><SPAN class="mw-editsection"><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</SPAN><A href="/w/index.php?title=Tangled:_The_Series&action=edit&section=11" title="Edit section: Tangled: Short Cuts (2017)">edit</A><SPAN class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</SPAN></SPAN></H3>

<H1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><I>Fortnite</I></H1>			<DIV id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
				<DIV id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</DIV>				<DIV id="contentSub"></DIV>
								<DIV id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<A href="#mw-head">navigation</A>, 					<A href="#p-search">search</A>
				</DIV>
				<DIV id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><DIV class="mw-parser-output"><DIV role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">For the battle royale version of the game, see <A href="/wiki/Fortnite_Battle_Royale" title="Fortnite Battle Royale">Fortnite Battle Royale</A>.</DIV>

<TH scope="row" style="white-space:nowrap;padding-right:0.65em;">Mode(s)</TH>
<TD style="line-height:1.3em;"><A href="/wiki/Single-player" class="mw-redirect" title="Single-player">Single-player</A>, <A href="/wiki/Multiplayer" class="mw-redirect" title="Multiplayer">multiplayer</A></TD>

<P><I><B>Fortnite</B></I> is a <A href="/wiki/Cooperative_gameplay" title="Cooperative gameplay">co-op</A> <A href="/wiki/Open_world" title="Open world">sandbox</A> <A href="/wiki/Survival_game" title="Survival game">survival game</A> developed by <A href="/wiki/Epic_Games" title="Epic Games">Epic Games</A> and <A href="/wiki/People_Can_Fly" title="People Can Fly">People Can Fly</A> and published by Epic Games. The game was released as a paid-for <A href="/wiki/Early_access" title="Early access">early access</A> title for <A href="/wiki/Microsoft_Windows" title="Microsoft Windows">Microsoft Windows</A>, <A href="/wiki/MacOS" title="MacOS">macOS</A>, <A href="/wiki/PlayStation_4" title="PlayStation 4">PlayStation 4</A> and <A href="/wiki/Xbox_One" title="Xbox One">Xbox One</A> on July 25, 2017, with a full <A href="/wiki/Free-to-play" title="Free-to-play">free-to-play</A> release expected in 2018. The retail versions of the game were published by <A href="/wiki/Gearbox_Software" title="Gearbox Software">Gearbox Publishing</A>, while online distribution of the PC versions is handled by Epic's launcher.</P>
<P><I>Fortnite</I> is set in contemporary Earth, where the sudden appearance of a worldwide storm causes 98% of the world's population to disappear, and zombie-like creatures rise to attack the remainder. Considered by Epic as a cross between <I><A href="/wiki/Minecraft" title="Minecraft">Minecraft</A></I> and <I><A href="/wiki/Left_4_Dead" title="Left 4 Dead">Left 4 Dead</A></I>, <I>Fortnite</I> has up to four players cooperating on various missions on randomly-generated maps to collect resources, build fortifications around defensive objectives that are meant to help fight the storm and protect survivors, and construct weapons and traps to engage in combat with waves of these creatures that attempt to destroy the objectives. Players gain rewards through these missions to improve their hero characters, support teams, and arsenal of weapon and trap schematics to be able to take on more difficult missions. The game is supported through <A href="/wiki/Microtransaction" title="Microtransaction">microtransactions</A> to purchase in-game currency that can be used towards these upgrades.</P>
<P>A standalone mode, <I><A href="/wiki/Fortnite_Battle_Royale" title="Fortnite Battle Royale">Fortnite Battle Royale</A></I>, based on the <A href="/wiki/Battle_royale_game" title="Battle royale game">battle royale game</A> genre but based on the core <I>Fortnite</I> gameplay, was released for the same platforms in September 2017.</P>
<P></P>

<LI class="toclevel-1 tocsection-2"><A href="#Gameplay"><SPAN class="tocnumber">2</SPAN> <SPAN class="toctext">Gameplay</SPAN></A></LI>
<LI class="toclevel-1 tocsection-3"><A href="#Development"><SPAN class="tocnumber">3</SPAN> <SPAN class="toctext">Development</SPAN></A>
